730781f-b.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - Staten Island
730781f-b.text:
11)
Goethals Bridge Site (Staten Island): Where the bridge plasa was later constructed at the end of Forest Avenue.
March 5, 1927
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Looking inland across the bridge site from near
Arthur Kill.
March 5, 1927
P. L. Sperr
(3)
Site of the approach to the bridge, neaP Western Avenues Before the bridge was officially named Goethals Bridge, it was known at the time of construction as the Howland Hook-Elisabeth
Bridge.
March 5, 1927
P. L. Sperr

730782f-b.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - Staten Island - [Arthur Kill - Old Place Creek.]
730782f-b.text:
Goethala Bridge site (Staten Island):  Vieweing northeastward along the bridge site and showing construction work on the marshed lying between Arthur Kill and Old Place Creek.  March 5, 1927

(2) Pile driver on the bridge site  March 5, 1927

June 14, 1935.

730785f-c.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - [Arthur Kill, Staten Island.]
730785f-c.text:
(1)
Goethals Bridger Viewing west across Arthur Kill toward
New Jersey.
June 14, 1935
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A view of the bridge, looking south on Arthur Kill from the New Jersey shore. Also shown is the Baltimore and Ohio
Railroad drawbridge.
June 14, 1935
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The bridge, as seen from Staten Island.
November 15, 1936
P. L. Sperr

730783f-b.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - [Old Place, Staten Island - Elizabeth, New Jersey.]
730783f-b.text:
(1) and (2)
Goethals Bridger The south side of the bridge,
viewed westward across the Sfaten Island marshes. The bridge links Old Place, Staten Island with Elizabeth, New Jersey.
View 1: July 8, 1928
View 2: August 26, 1930
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The north side of the bridge, seen across oil pipes
near the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad.
November 15, 1936
P. L. Sperr
